result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald D. Powers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Conditions: Not to possess a computer/cell phone or any electronic to access the internet. Must comply with sex offender registry.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald D. Powers in court with attorney James McLaughlin.  Defendant Ronald D. Powers in custody.  Angeline E Winton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances.  No additions or corrections the revocation packet. State speaks to the court re: sentencing.  Atty McL speaks to the court.   Defendant speaks to the court.

Sentencing-

2 years of initial confinement-2 years of E.S

Conditions: Must not possess computer/cell phone or any electronic to access internet. Must comply w/ Sex Offender Registry

Not eligible for programs

235 days credit.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 22, 2018 at 02:15 pm.
